market rate.translation[0].definitions[0: the real price or cost of something, decided by a market rather than calculated or fixed, for example by a government
Restrictive gas contracts required the company to purchase its gas at prices far above market rates.
market rate.translation[0].definitions[1: a typical rate for something on a market at a particular time
This measure will force credit card issuers to change from fixed to flexible rates, which would rise and fall with market rates.
market rate.translation[0].definitions[2: the price of something calculated in relation to what buyers are willing to pay at a particular time
The spread between the official and the market rate has remained at less than 1% for the past five years.
